sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

All 8 vocabulary words:

fail → ?       interrupt → ?
begin → ?      prevent → ?
end → ?        recur → ?
stop → ?       repeat → ?

(Answers: fliba, dicra, cfari, fanta, fanmo, krefu, sisti, rapli)

Grammar Summary (3-4 min)

Abstractors

Cmavo Creates Used with
nu Event djica, cfari, terpa, troci
du'u Proposition djuno, jimpe, xusra, tugni
ka Property nelci (quality), descriptions

Week 19 Vocabulary

Lojban English Lojban English
fliba fail dicra interrupt
cfari begin fanta prevent
fanmo end krefu recur
sisti stop rapli repeat

Self-Test (5-6 min)

Part A: Vocabulary (8 points)

Translate:

  1. fliba →
  2. cfari →
  3. sisti →
  4. fanta →

Translate to Lojban:

  1. end →
  2. interrupt →
  3. recur →
  4. repeat →
Answers
  1. fail
  2. begin
  3. stop
  4. prevent
  5. fanmo
  6. dicra
  7. krefu
  8. rapli

Part B: Abstractors (8 points)

Fill in the correct abstractor:

  1. mi djuno lo ___ do klama
  2. mi djica lo ___ citka
  3. mi nelci lo ___ melbi
  4. mi terpa lo ___ fliba

Create abstractions:

  1. The event of me going → ?
  2. The fact that you work → ?
  3. The property of being big → ?
  4. The event of failing → ?
Answers
  1. du'u
  2. nu
  3. ka
  4. nu
  5. lo nu mi klama
  6. lo du'u do gunka
  7. lo ka barda
  8. lo nu fliba

Part C: Complex Sentences (4 points)

Translate:

  1. I know you want to go.
  2. I begin to work.
  3. I fear failing.
  4. I hope you understand.
Answers
  1. mi djuno lo du'u do djica lo nu klama
  2. mi cfari lo nu gunka
  3. mi terpa lo nu fliba
  4. mi pacna lo nu do jimpe

Integration Challenge (1-2 min)

Express complex thoughts:

Use at least:

  • nu, du'u, and ka
  • Two of this week's vocabulary
  • One nested abstraction

Example:

mi djuno lo du'u do djica lo nu sisti lo nu gunka
.i mi jimpe lo du'u do tatpi
.i mi pacna lo nu do cfari lo nu sipna
.i lo ka sipna cu xamgu

(I know you want to stop working. I understand you're tired. I hope you begin to sleep. The property of sleeping is good.)

Create your own and say it aloud.

Summary

You completed Week 19 on abstractions. You can now turn sentences into events (nu), facts (du'u), and properties (ka).

Next week preview: Week 20 introduces relative clauses — poi, noi, ke'a.
